brief_details_ipc_bns.charges_related_to: Punishment for criminal intimidation
Assault or criminal force to deter public servant from discharge of his duty
Mischief causing damage to the amount of fifty rupees
Every member of unlawful assembly guilty of offence committed in prosecution of common object
Punishment for Being member of an unlawful assembly
Punishment for voluntarily causing hurt
Disobedience to order duly promulgated by public servant
Wrongful restraint
Punishment for Rioting
Voluntarily causing hurt to deter public servant from his duty
Acts done by several persons in furtherance of common intention
Attempt to commit offences punishable with imprisonment for life or other imprisonment
Assaulting or obstructing public servant when suppressing riot, etc.
Obstructing public servant in discharge of public functions
Voluntarily causing hurt by dangerous weapons or means
Continuance of nuisance after injunction
Punishment for public nuisance in cases not otherwise provided for
Voluntarily causing grievous hurt
Committing affray
Negligent act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
Malignant act likely to spread infection of disease dangerous to life
Disobedience to quarantine rule
Unlawful compulsory labour
Sale of obscene books, etc.
Delivering to another person as genuine a forged document or electronic record
Using false property mark
Punishment for Cheating
Fraudulent use of false instrument for weighing or of false measure
Abetment of any offence, if the act abetted is committed in consequence, and where no express provision is made for its punishment.
Voluntarily causing grievous hurt on provocation
Obscene acts and songs
